005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.markup;
007
008import com.vladsch.flexmark.util.sequence.Escaping;
009
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.util.XmlEventUtil;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.CollectionUtil;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
013
014import org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager;
015import org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger;
016import org.codehaus.stax2.XMLEventReader2;
017
018import java.net.URI;
019import java.util.Set;
020
021import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
022import javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamConstants;
023import javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException;
024import javax.xml.stream.events.Attribute;
025import javax.xml.stream.events.Characters;
026import javax.xml.stream.events.StartElement;
027import javax.xml.stream.events.XMLEvent;
028
029import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
030import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
031
032/**
033 * Provides utility functions to support reading and writing XML, and for
034 * producing error and warning messages.
035 */
036public final class XmlMarkupParser {
037  private static final Logger LOGGER = LogManager.getLogger(XmlMarkupParser.class);
038
039  /**
040   * The block element names that this parser supports.
041   */
042  @NonNull
043  public static final Set<String> XHTML_BLOCK_ELEMENTS = ObjectUtils.notNull(
044      Set.of(
045          "h1",
046          "h2",
047          "h3",
048          "h4",
049          "h5",
050          "h6",
051          "ul",
052          "ol",
053          "pre",
054          "hr",
055          "blockquote",
056          "p",
057          "table",
058          "img"));
059
060  @NonNull
061  private static final XmlMarkupParser SINGLETON = new XmlMarkupParser();
062
063  /**
064   * Get the singleton markup parser instance.
065   *
066   * @return the instance
067   */
068  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidSynchronizedAtMethodLevel")
069  @NonNull
070  public static synchronized XmlMarkupParser instance() {
071    return SINGLETON;
072  }
073
074  private XmlMarkupParser() {
075    // disable construction
076  }
077
078  /**
079   * Parse a single line of markup from XHTML.
080   *
081   * @param reader
082   *          the XML event stream reader
083   * @param resource
084   *          the resource being parsed
085   * @return the markup string
086   * @throws XMLStreamException
087   *           if an error occurred while parsing
088   */
089  public MarkupLine parseMarkupline(
090      @NonNull XMLEventReader2 reader,
091      @NonNull URI resource) throws XMLStreamException { // NOPMD - acceptable
092    StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder();
093    parseContents(reader, resource, null, buffer);
094    String html = buffer.toString().trim();
095    return html.isEmpty() ? null : MarkupLine.fromHtml(html);
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Parse a markup multiline from XHTML.
100   *
101   * @param reader
102   *          the XML event stream reader
103   * @param resource
104   *          the resource being parsed
105   * @return the markup string
106   * @throws XMLStreamException
107   *           if an error occurred while parsing
108   */
109  public MarkupMultiline parseMarkupMultiline(
110      @NonNull XMLEventReader2 reader,
111      @NonNull URI resource) throws XMLStreamException {
112    StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder();
113    parseToString(reader, resource, buffer);
114    String html = buffer.toString().trim();
115
116    if (LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
117      LOGGER.debug("XML->HTML: {}", html);
118    }
119    return html.isEmpty() ? null : MarkupMultiline.fromHtml(html);
120  }
121
122  /**
123   * Parse a markup multiline from XHTML.
124   *
125   * @param reader
126   *          the XML event stream reader
127   * @param resource
128   *          the resource being parsed
129   * @param buffer
130   *          the markup string buffer
131   * @throws XMLStreamException
132   *           if an error occurred while parsing
133   */
134  private void parseToString(
135      @NonNull XMLEventReader2 reader,
136      @NonNull URI resource,
137      @NonNull StringBuilder buffer) // NOPMD - acceptable
138      throws XMLStreamException {
139    // if (LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
140    // LOGGER.debug("parseToString(enter): {}",
141    // XmlEventUtil.toString(reader.peek()));
142    // }
143
144    outer: while (reader.hasNextEvent() && !reader.peek().isEndElement()) {
145      // skip whitespace before the next block element
146      XMLEvent nextEvent = XmlEventUtil.skipWhitespace(reader);
147
148      // if (LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
149      // LOGGER.debug("parseToString: {}", XmlEventUtil.toString(nextEvent));
150      // }
151
152      if (nextEvent.isStartElement()) {
153        StartElement start = nextEvent.asStartElement();
154        QName name = start.getName();
155
156        // Note: the next element is not consumed. The called method is expected to
157        // consume it
158        if (!XHTML_BLOCK_ELEMENTS.contains(name.getLocalPart())) {
159          // throw new IllegalStateException();
160          // stop parsing on first unrecognized event
161          break outer;
162        }
163        parseStartElement(reader, resource, start, buffer);
164      }
165      // reader.nextEvent();
166
167      // skip whitespace before the next block element
168      XmlEventUtil.skipWhitespace(reader);
169    }
170
171    // if (LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
172    // LOGGER.debug("parseToString(exit): {}", reader.peek() != null ?
173    // XmlEventUtil.toString(reader.peek()) : "");
174    // }
175  }
176
177  private void parseStartElement(
178      @NonNull XMLEventReader2 reader,
179      @NonNull URI resource,
180      @NonNull StartElement start,
181      @NonNull StringBuilder buffer)
182      throws XMLStreamException {
183    if (LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
184      LOGGER.debug("parseStartElement(enter): {}", XmlEventUtil.toString(start, resource));
185    }
186
187    // consume the start event
188    reader.nextEvent();
189
190    QName name = start.getName();
191    buffer.append('<')
192        .append(name.getLocalPart());
193    for (Attribute attribute : CollectionUtil.toIterable(
194        ObjectUtils.notNull(start.getAttributes()))) {
195      buffer
196          .append(' ')
197          .append(attribute.getName().getLocalPart())
198          .append("=\"")
199          .append(attribute.getValue())
200          .append('"');
201    }
202
203    XMLEvent next = reader.peek();
204    if (next != null && next.isEndElement()) {
205      buffer.append("/>");
206    } else {
207      buffer.append('>');
208
209      // parse until the start's END_ELEMENT is reached
210      parseContents(reader, resource, start, buffer);
211
212      buffer
213          .append("</")
214          .append(name.getLocalPart())
215          .append('>');
216
217      // the next event should be the start's END_ELEMENT
218      XmlEventUtil.assertNext(reader, resource, XMLStreamConstants.END_ELEMENT, name);
219    }
220    // consume end element event
221    reader.nextEvent();
222
223    if (LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
224      LOGGER.debug("parseStartElement(exit): {}",
225          reader.peek() != null
226              ? XmlEventUtil.toString(reader.peek(), resource)
227              : "");
228    }
229  }
230
231  private void parseContents(
232      @NonNull XMLEventReader2 reader,
233      @NonNull URI resource,
234      @Nullable StartElement start,
235      @NonNull StringBuilder buffer)
236      throws XMLStreamException {
237    // if (LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
238    // LOGGER.debug("parseContents(enter): {}",
239    // XmlEventUtil.toString(reader.peek()));
240    // }
241
242    XMLEvent event;
243    while (reader.hasNextEvent() && !(event = reader.peek()).isEndElement()) {
244      // // skip whitespace before the next list item
245      // event = XmlEventUtil.skipWhitespace(reader);
246
247      // if (LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
248      // LOGGER.debug("parseContents(before): {}", XmlEventUtil.toString(event));
249      // }
250
251      if (event.isStartElement()) {
252        StartElement nextStart = ObjectUtils.notNull(event.asStartElement());
253        // QName nextName = nextStart.getName();
254        parseStartElement(reader, resource, nextStart, buffer);
255
256        // if (LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
257        // LOGGER.debug("parseContents(after): {}",
258        // XmlEventUtil.toString(reader.peek()));
259        // }
260
261        // assert XmlEventUtil.isNextEventEndElement(reader, nextName) :
262        // XmlEventUtil.toString(reader.peek());
263
264        // reader.nextEvent();
265      } else if (event.isCharacters()) {
266        Characters characters = event.asCharacters();
267        buffer.append(Escaping.escapeHtml(characters.getData(), true));
268        reader.nextEvent();
269      }
270    }
271
272    assert start == null
273        || XmlEventUtil.isEventEndElement(reader.peek(), ObjectUtils.notNull(start.getName())) : XmlEventUtil
274            .generateExpectedMessage(reader.peek(), resource, XMLStreamConstants.END_ELEMENT, start.getName());
275
276    // if (LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
277    // LOGGER.debug("parseContents(exit): {}", reader.peek() != null ?
278    // XmlEventUtil.toString(reader.peek()) : "");
279    // }
280  }
281
282}
